item.title: SUMMER 2014 CLIMBING TRIP TO DOLOMITES DEADLINE - for years 10,11,12 and 13
item.description:
Body:
There are still a few places left for next year's DCMC climbing trip to the Dolomites in Italy. You've seen the posters. This promises to be a fantastic adventure: rock climbing, via-ferrata, trekking, amazing landscapes... + sightseeing in Venice!
The deadline for applying  is December 2nd. Interested?
For more information and forms contact Mr. Lacheze-Beer in person or via email.
AnnouncementImageUrl:
RankDate: 21/11/2013 09:31
StartsOn: 21/11/2013 09:31
Expires: 10/01/2014 00:00

item.title: LitSoc: A Clockwork Orange
item.description:
Body:
Dan Burkitt will be exploring why Anthony Burgess, creator of the Nadsat-talking teenage droog Alex, disapproved so stongly of Stanley Kubrick's controversial 1971 film of his novel.
 
Monday 25th November, 1.40pm, Room 52. All welcome

item.title: Carols by Candlelight Service 2013
item.description:
Body:
The entire College community, including staff and their families are invited to attend this Carols by Candlelight Service at Southwark Cathedral on Friday 13 December at 7.00pm. The service will last for about an hour and we do hope that you will want to join us for this Christmas celebration. RSVP...

item.author: Natalie Harzic

item.title: Invitation to Ballet at ENO, Le Corsiare 9th January
item.description:
Body:
The Dulwich College Opera Society has decided to offer as a change to normal proceedings and invites boys in the upper school to see a ballet at the ENO next term, Le Corsaire on the 9th January. This swashbuckling pirate adventure has had tremendous reviews and is currently on National Tour.
Tickets are £8 per student- excellent value for Upper Circle seats at the English National Opera.
Upper school boys interested in going should e mail Mr Emson before next Tuesday, the deadline as tickets need to be booked asap. Further details can be viewed online at eno.org: boarders there is a poster of the event in the main hall adjoining the two senior boarding houses. Thank you
RankDate: 21/11/2013 09:07
StartsOn: 21/11/2013 09:07
Expires: 27/11/2013 00:00

item.title: CV Workshop
item.description:
Body:
Get your CV noticed and translate your skills to the world of work
We will be holding a CV workshop on Thursday 21 November at 1.40pm in the Careers Department, LGB. This will be useful if you are thinking of a gap year, work experience or have simply never written a CV! All boys from Year 11 and Upper School are welcome. If you have a current CV please bring this with you.

item.author: Nicola Stoney

item.title: *AMADEUS almost Sold Out*
item.description:
Body:
Just a handful of tickets remain for this week's sumptuous production of 'Amadeus'.  Peter Shaffer's award-winning play presents Mozart as a genius who failed in his lifetime to get the recognition and celebrity he craved. Ultimately he is destroyed by the embittered court composer Salieri who, dwarfed by the young upstart's talent, plots Mozart's ruin, fuelled by his toxic envy.
Running time 2 hours 20 mins (including interval)
End time 9.50 approx)
AnnouncementImageUrl:
RankDate: 19/11/2013 11:43
StartsOn: 19/11/2013 11:43
Expires: 24/11/2013 00:00
OnHomePage: Yes
DisplayonOtherSites: Nowhere, Parents' Portal Homepage

item.title: Politics Society
item.description:
Body:
The Society is pleased to welcome Peter Riddell OA back to the College this week. Mr Riddell is a celebrated political commentator and fomer Political and Deputy Editor of the Times. He will be speaking on the fortunes of the parties in the run up to the 2015 election. He will also be taking plenty of questions from the floor. Masters' Library, Wednesday, 4pm.

item.author: David Flower

item.title: Dulwich College Classics Symposium
item.description:
Body:
The Classics department will be hosting a talk from Doctor Claire Holleran of Exeter University on "Shopping in Ancient Rome". The talk will take in the role of commerce in the Late Republic and Empire, and deal with questions of how the ancient economy functioned.
 
The talk will begin at 16:00, in the Old Library. There will be light refreshments available to staff and boys after the talk.
AnnouncementImageUrl:
RankDate: 19/11/2013 13:23
StartsOn: 19/11/2013 13:23
Expires: 19/11/2013 19:00
OnHomePage: Yes
DisplayonOtherSites: Nowhere

item.author: Antonia Stockwell

item.title: Upper School Cooking Society - Friday, 1.40 in the Master's Library
item.description:
Body:

 

Cooking – a life skill and an art form.

 

For those anxious about surviving at university, and for those looking develop their existing cooking skills, the Upper School Cooking Society caters for all.

 

We will look at various recipes from all over the globe and dissect numerous techniques in our theory sessions in order to prepare us for practical sessions in the Lent Term. Appetisers beyond the usual tea and biscuits may be available...

 

Our first meeting will take place in the Master’s Library at 1.40 this Friday. 

AnnouncementImageUrl:
RankDate: 18/11/2013 13:52
StartsOn: 18/11/2013 13:52
Expires: 22/11/2013 14:35

item.title: The RS Gym
item.description:
Body:
This week, Alex Murphy (OA) will be leading a discussion on ''What is this thing called Science?''
 
It would be great if as many boys as possible could support Alex, particularly those who take RS at GCSE, AS and A2.
 
Tuesday lunchtime in Room 5 at 1.40 pm.  Coffee and biscuits will be served.
 
Everyone welcome!
 
JHF

item.author: Jon H Fox

item.title: Oxbridge Classics Seminar
item.description:
Body:
Monday's seminar will centre on close readings of from Propertius book 1 (in particular poems 2,3,4 and 5) and will explore the theme of how women are presented within these poems, and the status of women as commodity within Latin elegy. Recommended for Oxbridge candidates and all studying for pre-U in 2014. HMSD
AnnouncementImageUrl:

item.title: 'Amadeus' Tickets
item.description:
Body:
Tickets are selling well for the performances next week.  Please book as soon as you can - you might not be able to buy tickets on the door.  If you are not using tickets please return them to the box office so we can re-allocate them. 
 
Tuesday: some availability
Wednesday: limited availability
Thursday: some availability
 
Box Office c/o: baskervilleh@dulwich.org.uk
